intro: Justicia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which give it its common name, and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and prolonged blooming period. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various garden settings. Justicia cordifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
